intro: Declieuxia anceps, commonly known as the golden bamboo or golden reed, is a species of grass native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, clumping growth habit and bright yellow to golden-green foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to form dense ground cover. Declieuxia anceps is also valued for its potential in erosion control and as a habitat for small wildlife.
